data.title: Eastern New Mexico University - Roswell
data.text:
Welcome to ENMU-Roswell

Success Starts Here!

Established in 1958, the campus of Eastern New Mexico University-Roswell (ENMU-Roswell) provides high quality, affordable education and life-long learning opportunities.

The faculty-student ratio is kept low, with small classes, allowing instructors to provide support and personal attention to students.

ENMU-Roswell is accredited by The Higher Learning Commission (HLC)

Available to students, faculty, and staff

Eastern New Mexico University Roswell has partnered with TimelyCare, higher education’s most trusted virtual health and well-being provider, to offer students free and equitable access to mental health support, medical care and basic needs assistance.

The need for 24/7 access to high-quality care has never been more important. According to the American Council on Education, student mental health is the top concern of college and university presidents. It’s also the number one reason students leave college. A recent report by Gallup and the Lumina Foundation found that 69% of students in bachelor’s degree programs who considered dropping out cited emotional stress as their reason.

Through TimelyCare on their phone or other device, Eastern New Mexico University Roswell students can now select from a wide-ranging menu of virtual care options from licensed physicians and counselors in all 50 states – at no cost and without the barrier of traditional insurance.

Additionally, faculty and staff have access to support that empowers them to guide students to TimelyCare resources to help students achieve a sense of well-being, live healthier lifestyles and improve their mental health.

Why Vote on Bond 3?

Campus Life

ENMU-Roswell offers a vibrant on-campus experience for both traditional and non-traditional students. Read up on the latest news or look ahead for upcoming events. If you need assistance, we have programs to help improve your academic performance or to aid with basic needs. We also offer On-line healthcare services via our new partner TimelyCare.

Visit the Program for Academic Support Services (PASS) page to get help from dedicated tutors in science, mathematics, language, writing, and technology

Tutors are available at various times throughout the week. You may schedule blocks of time with someone for in-person assistance or via Microsoft Teams. Appointments are limited. If there are no available time slots for the day that you have selected, please look ahead to the next most convenient available date. You will not have the option to book time with a tutor the day-of. The request must be made at least 24 hours in advance. However, it is not necessary to schedule an appointment. Walk-ins are welcome. If scheduling, you should confirm the location of your appointment with the tutor prior to arriving.

Cosmo's Cupboard

The food pantry stocks a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables, in addition to canned and packaged food items for ENMU-Roswell students.

The pantry is being funded by an allocation from the ENMU-Roswell Foundation and through two grants from the New Mexico Higher Education Department (NMHED) and Governor Michelle Lujan Grisham’s Food, Farm, and Hunger Initiative.

You will find the pantry in the Instructional Center room 121 near the student lounge.
